channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead Fox, 30th June
item.description:
There is a young dead fox on the pavement between 86 and 88 Newlands Park. Please can it be recovered and disposed of correctly.before any school children come along, it’s upsetting to see Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 151, Newlands Park, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another large flytip, Victoria Way, 30th June
item.description:
Mattresses and boilers dumped outside Peabody’s open bin store on corner of Tallis Grove, partly blocking pavement. Peabody seem not to care about people using their store as a place to dump large items.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Way, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep Hole in road surface, 29th June
item.description:
Pothole has been getting steadily deeper over the last 6 months. I saw a motorbike hit the hole making the rider jerk to the oncoming traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brampton Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burning oil odour, 29th June
item.description:
Persistent and strong odour of burning oil coming through the ventilation to my flat. Odour appear to be coming from the flat 14. Despite opening windows and using ventilation, the smell remains intense and has made it extremely difficult for us to sleep.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Micawber Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pavement is filthy and stained and is currently covered in a pile of abandoned clothes, 29th June
item.description:
The pavements on Seven Sisters Road, station place, Blackstock Road and Stroud Green are filthy, covered in stains and need a thorough power wash clean. The specific point highlighted on the map currently has a large pile of filthy clothes. Rubbish bins from shops and takeaway restaurants are left directly on the pavement, smelling horribly and are a disgraceful mess
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Stroud Green Road, Stroud Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Seven Sisters Road, Hackney, London

item.description:

item.title: Haverstock Hill junction with Eton Road, 29th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haverstock Hill, Chalk Farm, London
